==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|alt=𩠐}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han simp|𩠐|f=巛|t=丷}}. Originally {{Han compound|巛|𦣻|ls=psc}}.

===Etymology===
Sino-Tibetan; cognate with {{cog|lus|lu||head}}. This word has also been compared with {{cog|map-pro|*qulu|*quluh|head}} ({{cog|ms|hulu}}) and {{cog|tai-pro|*krawᶜ|*klawᶜ ~ krawᶜ|head; hair knot}} ({{cog|th|เกล้า||hair; head}}), and was used by Sagart to support his {{w|Sino-Austronesian languages|Sino-Austronesian hypothesis}}. Compare {{och-l|道|path, road}} (with the same phonetic component) and its relationship with {{cog|hmx-pro|*kləuX||road, way}}.

This word was replaced by {{och-l|頭|head}} by the ''{{w|Warring States}}'' period, possibly due to early homophony with {{och-l|手|hand}}.
